meanings.definition: Tzaddikim - plural noun: Righteous individuals in Jewish tradition.
meanings.sent1: In Jewish tradition, tzaddikim are highly respected for their righteousness.
meanings.sent2: The community looked up to the tzaddikim for their moral guidance.
meanings.sent3: The tzaddikim decided to have a friendly competition to see who could perform the most acts of kindness.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness shone brightly, making her stand out like a tzaddikim among ordinary people.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tzaddikim walking hand in hand left a lasting impression on the villagers.

meanings.definition: Tzaddikim - plural noun: Those who are considered righteous or just in a religious or moral sense.
meanings.sent1: The community admired the tzaddikim for their unwavering commitment to justice.
meanings.sent2: Many stories are told about the tzaddikim and their acts of kindness.
meanings.sent3: The tzaddikim organized a charity bake sale to raise funds for the orphanage.
meanings.sent4: His integrity and honesty made him a tzaddikim in the eyes of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The legacy of the tzaddikim continues to inspire future generations to strive for righteousness.
